conclusion: Use refraction and critical angle concepts to solve the problem.
Light bends away from the normal when traveling from water to air.
Critical angle is where total internal reflection occurs, causing an inverted cone of light.
Refractive index is the ratio of speed of light in vacuum to speed in the medium.
Vertex angle \(\alpha\) is related to critical angle \(\theta_c\) by \(\alpha = 2\theta_c\).
Substitute \(n_w\) into the refractive index formula to find \(v = c \cdot \sin\left(\frac{\alpha}{2}\right)\).
The speed of light in water is \(v = c \cdot \sin\left(\frac{\alpha}{2}\right)\).
